org.yawlfoundation.yawl.schema

Class SchemaHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.yawlfoundation.yawl.schema.SchemaHandler

  • public class SchemaHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    This object acts as a reusable Schema validator for a given schema. Once the schema has been successfully compiled, any number of XML documents can be validated by calling either of the validate methods.
    Author:
    Mike Fowler Date: 04-Jul-2006

      • SchemaHandler

        public SchemaHandler(java.lang.String xml)
        Constructs a new SchemaHandler
        Parameters:
        xml - XML String representing the schema this handler will use for validation

      • SchemaHandler

        public SchemaHandler(java.io.InputStream is)
        Constructs a new SchemaHandler
        Parameters:
        is - a Stream representing the schema this handler will use for validation

      • SchemaHandler

        public SchemaHandler(java.net.URL url)
        Constructs a new SchemaHandler
        Parameters:
        url - a URL to the XSD representing the schema this handler will use for validation

    • Method Detail

      • compileAndValidate

        public boolean compileAndValidate(java.lang.String xml)
        Compiles the schema, and if successful validates an XML String against it
        Parameters:
        xml - the XML String to validate against Schema
        Returns:
        true if the Schema compiles without error AND the XML is a valid instance of the Schema

      • compileSchema

        public boolean compileSchema()
        Attempts to compile the schema. If successful, allows an XML document to be validated.
        Returns:
        true if the schema has compiled successfully.

      • validate

        public boolean validate(java.lang.String xml)
        Validates the given XML document against the compiled schema.
        Parameters:
        xml - instance document to be validated.
        Returns:
        true if the xml is a valid instance of the schema
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if schema has not been compiled successfully

      • getErrorMessages

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getErrorMessages()
        Returns:
        all error messages from the last validation/compilation

      • getWarningMessages

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getWarningMessages()
        Returns:
        all warning messages from the last validation/compilation

      • getMessages

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getMessages()
        Returns:
        all messages from the last validation/compilation

      • getConcatenatedMessage

        public java.lang.String getConcatenatedMessage()
        Returns:
        all messages since the last validation/compilation

      • getSchema

        public java.lang.String getSchema()
        Returns:
        String representation of the schema

      • setSchema

        public void setSchema(java.lang.String schema)
        Parameters:
        schema - new schema to use (resets everything)

      • getPrimaryTypeNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getPrimaryTypeNames()
        Returns:
        the set of (first-level) type names defined in this schema

      • getDataTypeDefinition

        public Element getDataTypeDefinition(java.lang.String typeName)
        Gets the schema element definition of a data type by name
        Parameters:
        typeName - the data type name
        Returns:
        the corresponding definition, or null if the type name is unknown

      • getTypeMap

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Element> getTypeMap()
        Gets the map of data type names to their definitions
        Returns:
        the map of names to definitions
